intro: Paepalanthus karstenii var. minimus, commonly known as the dwarf puya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the bromeliad family and is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences that are typically red or orange in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in botanical gardens.
